sen.j: 1月1日の寅の刻（午前4時ごろ）に、天皇が綾綺殿で黄櫨染御袍（こうろぜんのごほう：みかどの朝服）を召され、清涼殿東庭に出御して天皇の属星（ぞくしょう：誕生年によって定まるという人間の運命を司る北斗七星のなかの星）、天地四方の神霊や父母の天皇陵などの方向を拝し、その年の国家・国民の安康、豊作などを祈った。
sen.e: On January 1st, torano koku (around 4 o'clock in the mourning), the Emperor wearing Korozen no go-ho at Ryoki-den came to east garden of Seiryo-den and prayed for his Zokusho (one of the star of the Big Dipper, which it is said to have destiny depending on the year the person was born) and spirits in any directions, or the direction of parent's Imperial Mausoleum, then wished for the peace and security of a nation, and having good harvests for the coming year.

sen.e: On January 1st, around 5:30 in the morning, the present Emperor wearing a traditional formal court dress called Korozen no go-ho, goes into a building built in the southern garden of Shinka-den, which is located west of the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court, then take bow towards the direction of two shrines, Ko-tai jingu Shrine and Toyouke Dai-jingu Shrine of Ise Shrine/Ise-jingu Shrine, followed by praying for various spirits in any directions.
